intro: Collomia debilis var. ipomoea, commonly known as the slender collomia, is a flowering plant native to the western United States. It belongs to the nightshade family (Solanaceae) and is characterized by its delicate, pale purple to white flowers. The plant typically grows in open, rocky habitats and has a low, spreading growth habit. Its leaves are ovate to lanceolate, with hairy surfaces, and it produces small, capsule-like fruits. The species is of interest to botanists due to its unique morphology and limited distribution.
